column1: Kata Robata////NOT RECOMMENDED. Highly overpriced. After $250
column2: we still left the place hungry. Sushi rolls were average at best. But way too skinny for the price. Sashimi was also average in freshness
column3: but the slices were so small and thin that I thought I was eating in a French restaurant. The description of many of dishes lacked information. For example
column4: one of the dishes I ordered was an octopus slice dish that cost $15. I ordered that as my entree. As it turns out
column5: it was much more of an appetizer than anything else. And even as an appetizer
column6: the portion was ridiculously small. With so many sushi places in Houston
column7: I will definitely not go back. Oishii down the street is MUCH better. On the positive side
column8: our waiter was very good. Hostesses
